qas.question: What did Darwin say that artificial selection by animal breeders often causes?

answers.text: sharp divergence in character between breeds,

qas.question: What did Darwin say could happen somewhere if there is a change in conditions?
What can happen if species immigrate to a new location?

answers.text: descendants of some species became adapted to new conditions

context: Chapter IV details natural selection under the "infinitely complex and close-fitting ... mutual relations of all organic beings to each other and to their physical conditions of life". Darwin takes as an example a country where a change in conditions led to <a1_0>extinction of some species<a1_0/>, immigration of others and, where suitable variations occurred, <a2_0>descendants of some species became adapted to new conditions<a2_0/>. He remarks that the artificial selection practised by animal breeders frequently produced <a0_0>sharp divergence in character between breeds,<a0_0/> and suggests that natural selection might do the same, saying:
